medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset right lower quadrant pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain woke the patient from sleep around 3 AM on the morning of admission and continued upon waking a few hours later. The patient took Tylenol with codeine and was able to fall back asleep. The pain is different in location and quality compared to previous ulcerative colitis flares. Associated symptoms include mild flushing/chills with no fever, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, hematochezia, dyspnea, or chest pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ulcerative colitis (currently well controlled), diagnosed in unspecified year.
medical_history.family_history: His uncle and cousin have Crohn's disease; no family history of colon cancer; his brother has depression; his great uncle has alcoholism.
